page.title: 04Railway Survey
page.content:
Bromley's main development followed the arrival of the railway which enabled people to work in London and live in the countryside. This survey investigates the present importance of the railway to the local community.
969 children, from six local schools, completed the questionnaire. The first column gives the totals for children aged 5 to 11 years, and the second column for those aged 12 to 18 years.
No.in sample 697 272 0 journeys in previous year 133 6 1-4 journeys 287 38 5-10 journeys 150 53 Over 10 journeys 127 175 No. of parents commuting by train 271 102
